STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_031_chunk6
evidence_span: Over 80 percent of the world's annual output of zirconium is fabricated into components for nuclear reactors

source_id: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_031_chunk6
evidence_span: CANDU power reactor program will require nearly 500 Mg of zirconium

source_id: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_031_chunk6
evidence_span: by 1986 the requirement will have risen to nearly 800 Mg

source_id: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_031_chunk6
evidence_span: tubes which can cost as much as $80/123

source_id: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_031_chunk6
evidence_span: Small thin walled tubes for fuel cladding are fabricated by heavily cold working extruded tubes

source_id: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_031_chunk6
evidence_span: The most important fabrication parameter in producing the desired crystallographic texture, hydride orientation, and mechanical properties is the cold reduction route

source_id: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_031_chunk6
evidence_span: Large-diameter thin-walled tubes are used to guide coolant flow, guide control rods, or for calandria tubes

source_id: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_031_chunk6
evidence_span: These tubes can be made by seam welding annealed sheet

source_id: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_031_chunk6
evidence_span: The weld and heat-affected zones must be recrystallized by cold work and heat treatment so that they have adequate ductility after irradiation

source_id: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_031_chunk6
evidence_span: Pressure containment tubes usually are fabricated by hot extrusion and cold worked a limited amount to size

source_id: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_031_chunk6
evidence_span: The most important fabrication parameters are the forging and extrusion processes because they determine the crystallographic texture and the microstructure of the tubes

source_id: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_031_chunk6
evidence_span: Taiwan research reactor calandria vessel, Fig. 1, which was made from 6.3-mm-thick Zircaloy-2 plate
